Expectation1: Prepare and maintain financial records accurately.
Situation1: An external auditor has just requested specific financial statements for an immediate review.
Situation2: They travel a long distance to participate in an important religious festival, ensuring they fully engage in all rituals and offerings.
Story: I sat in my hotel room, the scent of incense from the temple still clinging to my clothes. My phone buzzed again—another email from the external auditor, marked urgent. They needed the quarterly financial statements by noon, and I knew the files weren’t quite ready. As an accountant, accuracy and timeliness were everything; my reputation depended on it. But outside, the sounds of the festival called to me—chants, bells, the laughter of my family. Today was the most important day of the festival, and my parents had traveled even farther than I had, expecting me to join them in every ritual, every offering. My mind raced, torn between the duty to my profession and the devotion to my faith. I stared at my laptop, then at the temple lights flickering through the window, feeling the weight of both worlds pressing in, unsure which one I would let down.
